\documentclass[american]{article}
\usepackage[T1]{fontenc}
\usepackage{textcomp}
\usepackage[utf8]{inputenc}
\usepackage{amsmath}
\usepackage{babel}
\begin{document}
Let there be $M$ messages, posted at random times $t_{1},t_{2},\dots,t_{n}.$
For the $m$-th message, the measurement of the increase of emoticons
is done at times $s_{m,1},s_{m,2},\dots$ . Let $C_{m.\sigma}$ is
the increase of the number of emoticons between $s_{m,\sigma-1}$
and $s_{m,\sigma}$, and let $C_{m}$ be the number of reactions to
the message $m$. Assume $C_{m,\sigma}=0$ for $\sigma>A$ for some
$A$. Denote
\[
I_{m,\sigma}=\begin{cases}
\max(i:t_{m}+i<s_{\sigma}) & t_{m}\leq s_{m,\sigma}\\
-\infty & t_{m}>s_{m,\sigma}
\end{cases}
\]
Our hypothesis is that, for each $m,\sigma$ ,
\[
\]
 
\[
p_{m,\sigma}=\begin{cases}
\tau_{m,\sigma}\eta_{J_{\sigma}}\alpha_{0}, & I_{m,\sigma}=0\\
\tau_{m,\sigma}\eta_{J_{\sigma}}\alpha_{I_{m,\sigma}}+\varsigma_{m,\sigma}\eta_{J_{\sigma-1}}\alpha_{I_{m,\sigma}-1}, & 0<I_{m,\sigma}\\
0 & \text{\ensuremath{I_{m,\sigma}}=-\ensuremath{\infty}}
\end{cases}
\]
where 
\[
p_{m,\sigma}=C_{m,\sigma}/C_{m}
\]
\begin{align*}
\tau_{m,\sigma} & =s_{m,\sigma}-\max(s_{\sigma-1},t_{m}+I_{m,\sigma})
\end{align*}
\[
\varsigma_{m,\sigma}=\max(s_{m,\sigma-1},t_{m}+I_{m,\sigma})-s_{m,\sigma-1}
\]
\[
J_{\sigma}=(((\sigma-1)\mathrm{\:div\:}(2S)\mod{(48/S)})
\]
Here, $S$ is the number of seasonal coefficients, $\alpha_{0},\alpha_{1},\dots$
and $\eta_{0},\dots,\eta_{24}$ are unknown positive coefficients.
Our goal is to estimate $\alpha_{0},\alpha_{1},\dots,\alpha_{A}$
and $\eta_{0},\dots,\eta_{24}$ by some statistic technique.Â¨
\end{document}
